info.headline: Tropical Storm Watch issued November 12 at 3:11AM ChST by NWS Tiyan GU
info.description:
...TROPICAL STORM MAN-YI NEARLY STATIONARY...
.NEW INFORMATION... Tropical cyclones often slow down when getting ready to turn. Man-yi is likely about to make its turn toward the Marianas.
.AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands.
.Watches/Warnings... A Tropical storm watch continues for Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan.
Please check the latest public and marine forecasts for detailed information about additional hazards.
.STORM INFORMATION... At 1 AM ChST...the center of Tropical Storm Man-yi (25W) was located near latitude 14.0N...longitude 151.7E. This was about 460 miles east of Guam. Storm motion was south-southwest, 205 degrees, at 2 mph. Storm intensity was 45 mph.
.SITUATION OVERVIEW... It is too early to provide exact wind and surge forecast values for specific locations.
In general, breezy east winds are expected for most of the Marianas on Wednesday. Near the center of Tropical Storm Man-yi, damaging winds from variable directions will be likely.
Man-yi is currently expected to pass closest to Guam and Rota, however the track has been shifting and is therefore uncertain.
.PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
info.instruction: Stay informed and listen for possible changes to the forecast. Preparations for this storm should be made as soon as possible.

parameter.value: Tropical Storm Watch remains in effect
